input: Sentence: 'She will be arriving soon.' Word: 'arriving'
validityText:
The given input consists of a sentence: "She will be arriving soon." and a word: "arriving". According to the input specification, the sentence can be of any length and contain any combination of words, numbers, symbols, or foreign words. The word must be a part of the sentence. The sentence provided complies with these conditions, as it contains typical English words and fits the allowed leniency in content.

Furthermore, the word given is "arriving", which is indeed present in the sentence "She will be arriving soon." This satisfies the requirement that the word must be a word present in the sentence.

Since all aspects of the input meet the criteria specified in the input specification, there is no violation detected.

OK
